Hero.title: MBio7, ecology serving construction.
Hero.description: We transform wood waste into housing. We invented the mBio7 panel to allow everyone to build scalable homes.

Mbio7.title: Building Better ECOLOGICALLY
Mbio7.description: MBio7 is revolutionizing the construction materials sector by offering a sustainable and eco-friendly solution. With its negative carbon footprint, it actively contributes to the fight against climate change while ensuring exceptional performance in terms of thermal and acoustic insulation.

slide1.title: From Wood waste to Eco-Friendly Homes
slide1.description: Pioneering technology to transform recycled materials into high-performance, durable construction panels. ♻️

slide2.title: Recycled Materials
slide2.description: Building a greener future with homes crafted from recycled content, reducing waste and environmental impact.

slide3.title: Transforming to construction panels
slide3.description: Innovative processes turning recycled materials into robust, eco-friendly construction panels for sustainable living.

slide4.title: Building Homes, Saving the Planet
slide4.description: Creating sustainable homes with recycled materials, reducing carbon footprints, and promoting eco-friendly living.

About.title: A solution for everyone, everywhere
About.description: Designed for sustainable, earthquake-resistant, healthy, frost-resistant, economical, and modular constructions — We invented the mBio7 panel to allow everyone to build scalable homes.

points.point1: It is water and fire resistant
points.point2: It is not afraid of termites or any other type of insect

Impact.title: Sustainable & human approach
Impact.description: MBio7 is the eco-constructive solution that combines quick installation, technical performance, and environmental respect.

stat2.title: Kg of CO₂ saved per panel

stat3.title: Tonnes of CO₂ avoided per 120 m² house

point1.title: Durability
point1.description: Made from natural and renewable materials, MBio7 is designed to last, thereby reducing the need for frequent replacements and minimizing waste.

point2.title: Performance
point2.description: Offering exceptional thermal and acoustic insulation, MBio7 improves indoor comfort while reducing energy costs.

point3.title: Sustainability
point3.description: With a negative carbon footprint, MBio7 actively contributes to environmental preservation and the fight against climate change.

point4.title: Versatility
point4.description: Suitable for a wide range of applications, from residential to industrial buildings, MBio7 adapts to various construction needs.

point5.title: Ease of installation
point5.description: Lightweight and modular, MBio7 allows for quick and easy installation, reducing construction time and labor costs.

point6.title: Health
point6.description: Made from natural materials, MBio7 contributes to a healthier indoor environment by improving air quality and reducing allergens.

q1.question: What is the MBio7 panel?
q1.answer: MBio7 is an innovative construction panel, made of more than 90% recycled wood. It is lightweight, modular, and designed for sustainable, cost-effective, and fast construction.

q2.question: What is the environmental performance of the panel?
q2.answer: Each panel has a negative carbon footprint of -7.66 kg CO₂-eq. A 120 m² house built with MBio7 helps avoid around 3 tons of CO₂.

q3.question: Is the panel resistant?
q3.answer: Yes. MBio7 is resistant to water, fire, termites, frost, and earthquakes. It is a thermosetting material that does not rot and is unaffected by humidity.

q4.question: Is it compliant with construction standards?
q4.answer: Yes. Constructions using MBio7 comply with the RE 2020 standard when combined with suitable insulation.

q5.question: How much does a panel weigh?
q5.answer: An MBio7 panel weighs around 9 kg, which makes it easy to transport and install.

q6.question: Can a complete house be built with this material?
q6.answer: Yes. For example, a 10 m² test house was built in 2017 in Sospel with 160 panels (≈ 1,450 kg). The panels assemble easily and allow projects of any size.

q7.question: What is the production capacity?
q7.answer: About 400 panels per day for now, as we are currently in an expansion phase.

q8.question: Who is MBio7 intended for?
q8.answer: The material is ideal for NGOs (emergency reconstruction), local authorities, and individuals seeking ecological, modular, and cost-effective housing.

fabrication1.title: An innovative manufacturing process
fabrication1.description: Based on a technique mastered for over 30 years to produce molded wood pallets, creating housing panels in the shape of our mBio7 panels required more than three years of research and development, ultimately leading to the production of a construction panel with astonishing and ambitious characteristics.

specials.point2: Over 10 years of research and innovation

fabrication2.title: The origin of the material
fabrication2.description: At the origin, there is the material, molded wood, made of more than 90% recycled wood. It is a natural and bio-sourced product. The molded wood is then dried and mixed with thermosetting resin without formaldehyde.

specials.point3: Durability and respect for the environment

fabrication3.title: Shaping and Solidifying
fabrication3.description: The whole is placed in a press equipped with a mBio7 mold. A force of more than 900 tons is applied to the material. 170° cooking for several minutes will solidify the composite material through thermosetting. And our mBio7 panel automatically comes out, ready to be used after cooling.

Experience.title: A little home of your own is better than a big one at someone else's
Experience.description: A home of your own, simply, big or small, but one that protects your family and allows you to save money while respecting nature. mBio7 allows all this and much more

experience1.title: HEALTHY
experience1.description: Due to its design, it's a healthy, non-absorbent product, meaning it's free of moisture and the possibility of mold growth. When combined with other healthy materials, your construction will maintain its pleasant living environment over time.

experience2.title: STRUCTURAL SECURITY
experience2.description: Unlike traditional brick constructions, molded wood is an indivisible product (it doesn't crack). An mBio7 wall can't crack and, thanks to its assembly technique, provides the necessary flexibility to withstand ground movements. Assembling mBio7 panels correctly makes it easy to build earthquake-resistant homes.

specials.point3: Facilitates the construction of earthquake-resistant homes

experience3.title: FIRE SAFETY
experience3.description: When combined with M1 class materials, the absence of air inside the mBio7 panels makes it an extremely difficult product to burn and impossible to self-ignite.

specials.point1: Absence of air inside the panels

experience4.title: THERMAL INSULATION
experience4.description: Thanks to its alveolar structure, the mBio7 panel offers exceptional thermal insulation. It helps maintain a comfortable indoor temperature, reducing the need for heating and air conditioning.

specials.point3: Reduces the need for heating and air conditioning

blog1.title: Innovative eco-material for housing construction
blog1.description: Innovative eco-material for housing construction, mBio7 is the result of a dream, that of Dominique Tallarida, which became a reality with the help of his friend and associate Denis Mary. Awarded a prize at the prestigious Lépine competition in 2015, the project is now seeking funds to start its semi-automatic industrial production and has launched a crowdfunding campaign (donations) on Monaco Crowdfunding for this purpose.

blog2.title: Wood is put on notice
blog2.description: Two Lépine competition winners have created eco-friendly housing and want to turn it into emergency shelters.

blog3.title: A subscription launched for emergency homes
blog3.description: Winners of the Lépine competition, Dominique Tallarida from Sospel and his friend Denis Mary are preparing to commercialize their humanitarian housing concept. They need one last push.

UtilisationHero.title: How to use mBio7 panels?
UtilisationHero.description: mBio7 panels are versatile and can be used in various types of construction and renovation projects. Here are some of the main uses for mBio7 panels:

details.point6: Exterior and interior insulation of existing buildings
details.point7: Use as permanent formwork (swimming pools or retaining walls)

UtilisationMain.title: First ecological house in molded wood panels in France
UtilisationMain.description: In 2017, a first test house was built in Sospel with the help of Jérémy, a young intern engineer from the ESTIA Institute of Technology. It's a small building due to the limited number of prototypes, but mBio7 can be used for any size of construction. This structure is perfectly intact to this day, despite the years and harsh mountain conditions, with perfect insulation and not a single crack despite the absence of foundations.
